title: Script and Serif
content:
Love these two fonts together but can't ID them. Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019061232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HE05d2JSna_6273.jpeg)
author: dseebles

comments.content:
For "HAPPY" and "NAKED" look at this thread:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/30019](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019061232/http:/typophile.com/node/30019 "http://typophile.com/node/30019")

Closest I can find to the script is [Filmotype Lakeside](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019061232/http:/old.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lakeside/). The font includes the alternates that Lakeside came with originally (predigitally) - including your style of r.

HAPPY and NAKED are an inline version of a 19th century slab serif font named Hellenic wide. Several digital versions including [Lonestar](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019061232/http:/www.fontspring.com/fonts/fontmesa/lonestar) by Font Mesa, and [Hellenic Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019061232/http:/typekit.com/fonts/hellenic-wide) by Veer  
Don
